question_text: Which month had the highest average temperature?
answer_explanation: August . The peak point in the graph is for the month of August

question_text: Which month had the lowest average temperature?
answer_explanation: February. The lowest point of the graph is in the month of February

question_text: April and May have the same average temperature as June and July.
answer_explanation: False. April and May have the same average temperature as November and December.

question_text: Which make of car was the most popular?
answer_explanation: Nissan. It outsold all the other make of cars.

question_text: Which 2 makes of car sold over 150 each?
answer_explanation: Vauxhall and Peugeot. You can see that the bars for these makes, extend over the 150 mark.

question_text: Which was the lowest selling make?
answer_explanation: Jaguar. The bar for this make is the smallest of all.

question_text: Here's how I spent the past 24 hours? Match the table and pie chart to find out what I spent
answer_explanation: Working. I spent an hour more at work than I did sleeping.

question_text: I spent more time on meals than travel and getting dressed combined.
answer_explanation:
False I spent exactly the same amount of time on meals (2.25 hours) as getting dressed and travel 
combined (1.75 + 0.5 = 2.25 hours)

question_text: I spent less time watching TV than on doing my household chores.
answer_explanation: False. In fact I spent MORE time watching TV (1.5 hours) than on chores (1.25 hours)

question_text: What did I spend the least amount of time doing?
answer_explanation:
getting dressed I spent only half an hour (0.5) getting dressed whereas I spent  three quarters of an hour 
(0.75) swimming.

question_text: Choose the graph that best fits with this statement: "House prices rose in January and
answer_explanation: The graph shows the line rising, then falling and finally flattening out.

question_text: Choose the graph that best fits with this statement: "The TV licence has been frozen for the
answer_explanation: Graph A is a horizontal straight line confirming that that there has been no rise or fall in cost.

question_text: Choose the graph that best fits with this statement: "This car has excellent acceleration".
answer_explanation: The straight line shows that the car steadily picks up speed from a standstill position.

question_text: Choose the graph that best fits with this statement: "The price of groceries is still rising".
answer_explanation: The line in this graph is rising  upwards. You might have thought that it could have been C, but the price of groceries could not be zero.

question_text: Look at the Venn diagram. Which country is in the United Kingdom but not in Great Britain?
answer_explanation: Northern Ireland. You can see that the circle labelled Great Britain does not include Northern Ireland.

question_text: Look at the Venn diagram. How many countries are in included in the United Kingdom?
answer_explanation: 4. The 4 countries are England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

question_text: From the Venn diagram, can you identify the 2 nations that make up the british Isles?

options.text: Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland
United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland

answer_explanation: The British Isles are made up of the United Kingdom (which includes Great Britain and Northern Ireland) and the Republic of Ireland.

question_text: Look at the Venn diagram. Northern Ireland is part of Ireland as well as the United Kingdom.
answer_explanation:
True. You can see that Northern Ireland is in the section which overlaps both the United Kingdom 
and Ireland circles

question_text: What service does the Council spend on the most?
answer_explanation:
Adult Community Care You can see that the largest portion of the pie is coloured orange. It is also the highest 
percentage of the pie (30.2%).

question_text: What percentage of the Council's income is spent on Education?

options.text: more than on Children and Families

answer_explanation: more than on Children and Families The 17.2% spent on Education is greater than the 11.5% spending on Children and Families.

question_text: We collected data about the colour of shoes worn by 30 adults in a group. From the bar chart,
answer_explanation: Brown. The tallest bar is for the colour black, and the second tallest bar is for the colour brown.

question_text: From the bar chart, find the second most popular colour of shoes amongst women.
answer_explanation: Red. The tallest bar for women is for the colour black, and the second tallest bar is for the colour red.

question_text: From the bar chart, how many adults wore white shoes?
answer_explanation: Correct! 1 man and one woman had white shoes

question_text: From the bar chart, find the total number of women who took part in the survey of shoe
answer_explanation: The number of learners we’ve had in our college has dropped significantly over the last five years. The line on the graph has dropped sharply.

question_text: Which of these statements best describes what is shown in the graph?

options.text: The number of learners we’ve had in our college has dropped significantly over the last
There has been a small decrease in the number of learners in our college over the last
There has been no significant change in the number of learners in the last five years

answer_explanation:
There has been no significant change in the number of learners in the last five years. 
The number of learners has not increased, nor has it dropped by over a 100. The line has 
only a slight slope downwards

question_text: From the graph, what was the decrease in the number of learners between Years 1 and 2?
answer_explanation:
15 In year 1 there were 545 learners, and in year 2 there were the 530. The decrease is 545 - 
530 =15

question_text: There was a small increase in numbers between Years 2 and 3 (see image above).
answer_explanation: True. The learner numbers increased from 530 to 534

question_text: Which of these statements best describes what is shown in the graph?

options.text: The number of learners we’ve had in our college has dropped by over a 100 over the last
There has been a small increase in the number of learners in our college over the last five
There has been no significant change in the number of learners in the last five years

question_text: The number of learners in year 1 was about…..
answer_explanation: 550 The line graph starts at a point halfway between the 500 and 600 mark.

question_text: The number of learners in year 5 (see image above) was about…..
answer_explanation:
510 The point on the line graph for year 5 is definitely higher than 500 but not halfway between 
500 and 600.
